pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks with President of Rwanda Paul Kagame | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Today, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau spoke with the President of Rwanda, Paul Kagame.

The Prime Minister and the President discussed efforts to fight the COVID-19 pandemic, and exchanged views on the latest developments in Canada and Rwanda with respect to protecting health and safety while ensuring economic recovery. 

The two leaders also spoke of the strong friendship between Canada and Rwanda, and discussed opportunities to further advance shared priorities in education, research, and the Vancouver Principles.

COVID-19 is a rapidly evolving global challenge. The Government of Canada is working closely with local, provincial, territorial, and international partners to minimize its health, economic, and social impacts in Canada and around the world.
